page.title: 13 THE REDGRAVE THEATRE
page.content: In January,1985,the whole school walked down to the Redgrave Theatre for a special performance of "The Owl and The Pussy Cat". This was to celebrate both our school's and the theatre's Tenth Birthday. We have many connections with our local theatre; some of us belong to the Junior Theatre Club.We have had several chances to take part in productions where children are needed,such as "Calvacade". The 4th year have been shown many of the behind scenes aspects of the theatre.There is a touring group "Theatreaction",who visit schools with suitable plays.We have enjoyed these at our school.The stage manager,set designer and wardobe mistress came to give us some very interesting talks in assembly.The Theatre is named after Sir Michael Redgrave.
